subject: Learning
title: Special Education: From Exclusion to Inclusion
description: A quick win: understand Special Education: From Exclusion to Inclusion.

hook.text: In 1970, US schools legally excluded over one million children with disabilities. No education at all.

buildup.text: Children with disabilities were placed in institutions, kept home, or ignored by the school system.

discovery.text: The 1975 law (now IDEA) guaranteed a free, appropriate public education for every child with a disability.

twist.text: The shift from segregated special classrooms to inclusive mainstream settings transformed expectations.

climax.text: Inclusion benefits all studentsâ€”research shows typically developing peers also gain social and academic skills.

punchline.text: Every child deserves a classroom. Not a waiting room.

quiz.question: What did the IDEA law guarantee?
options: A free, appropriate public education for every child with a disability
Segregated schools for children with disabilities
Home schooling as the only option for disabled students
